title: A Look at the Wizard Works Alakazam for the Pelago Rasket
content:
I love my Pelago Rasket on my Crust Bikes Dreamer but one of the things I’m not stoked about it are the limited bag offerings. After reaching out to a variety of bag makers, requesting a “custom” bag for my Rasket, the team at Wizard Works threw its wizard cap into the arena and offered to help me out. Well, after a few months, my Alakazam bag designed specifically to the dimensions of the Raskett, showed up and I shot some initial photos of this nifty bag this morning, so let’s check it out in detail below!

Perhaps the only downside to the Pelago Rasket platform is it uses a non-standard — i.e. non-Wald basket size — basket. Yet, this custom Alakazam fits it like a glove.

The Alakazam fills out the rounded corners with its VX/Cordura fabric construction.

It secures to the basket via G-buckle metal hooks and adjusts with a slip clip.

The flap on top pulls back, exposing the velcro secure strips. The clips attach to extra straps for carrying large cargo because #carryshitolympics.

The roll-top opens to a cavernous capacity.

This rolltop closes with buttons and rolls down, allowing the main flap to secure the contents. An additional shoulder strap is supplied as well as expanding cargo straps.

The Rasket is a great platform for those wanting a rack and a robust basket in one but its main design flaw is the availability — or lack thereof — of cargo bags. Wizard Works’ Alakazam currently comes in two models for the Wald 137 with a 9-38L capacity and a Wald 139 20-70L capacity. The Rasket bag is somewhere in between those sizes, somewhere in the 15-50L range. Right now, I’m currently using this bike as a grocery getter and bike shop cruiser, so the Alakazam will be hauling food, parts, tires, etc, although I do believe this would make for a great basketpacking option for a S24O or the like.

I’m not sure if Harry and the Wizard Works crew will be offering this option — I don’t see why they wouldn’t? — so maybe drop them a line if you have a Rasket and see what they say! This bag cost me £179 plus DHL Worldwide shipping, so make sure you’re willing to pay a premium for a premium product made in the UK by the sorcerers at Wizard Works.

Why We Love the Wizard Works Alakazam

-Made in the UK
-Custom colors
-High capacity
-Secure on rough terrain thanks to secure straps
-Portageable with extra straps

Got questions? Holler in the comments!
